statements.name: PROC RELIABILITY
statements.description: BY variables; CLASS variables; DISTRIBUTION distribution-name; FMODE keyword = variable('value1' ... 'valuen'); FREQ variable; INSET keyword-list< options>; MAKE 'table' OUT=SAS-data-set < / options>; NENTER variable; UNITID variable; † The RELIABILITY procedure provides tools for reliability and survival data analysis and for recurrence data analysis. You can use this procedure to: † o construct probability plots and fitted life distributions with left-censored, right-censored, and interval-censored lifetime data o fit regression models, including accelerated life test models, to combinations of left-censored, right-censored, and interval-censored data o analyze recurrence data from repairable systems † These tools benefit reliability engineers and industrial statisticians working with product life data and system repair data. They also aid workers in other fields, such as medical research, pharmaceuticals, social sciences, and business, where survival and recurrence data are analyzed.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies a catalog for saving graphical output.

arguments.name: NAMELEN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of effect names in tables and output data sets to be n characters long, where n is a value between 20 and 200 characters. The default length is 20 characters.

statements.name: ANALYZE
statements.description: You use the ANALYZE statement to estimate the parameters of the probability distribution specified in the DISTRIBUTION statement without producing any graphical output.

arguments.name: CONFIDENCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.95.

arguments.name: CONVERGE=
arguments.description: Sets the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: CONVH=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.

arguments.name: COORB
arguments.description: Requests parameter correlation matrix.

arguments.name: COVB
arguments.description: Requests parameter covariance matrix.

arguments.name: FITTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies method of estimating distribution parameters.
arguments.help: FITTYPE=LSYX | LSXY | MLE | MODEL | NONE | WEIBAYES<(CONFIDENCE=number)>

arguments.name: LSYX
arguments.description: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The probability axis is the dependent variable.

arguments.name: LSXY
arguments.description: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The lifetime axis is the dependent variable.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Maximum likelihood (default)

arguments.name: MODEL
arguments.description: Uses the fit from the preceding MODEL statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No fit is computed.

arguments.name: WEIBAYES
arguments.description: Weibayes method, where number is the confidence coefficient for the Weibayes fit and is between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.95.

arguments.name: ITPRINT
arguments.description: Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: ITPRINTEM
arguments.description: Requests iteration history for the Turnbull algorithm.

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

arguments.name: LRCL
arguments.description: Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.

arguments.name: LRCLPER
arguments.description: Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution percentiles.

arguments.name: MAXIT=
arguments.description: Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: MAXITEREM=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed for the Turnbull algorithm. Iteration history will be displayed in increments of n2 if requested with the ITPRINTEM option.

arguments.name: NOPCTILES
arguments.description: Suppresses computation of percentiles for standard list of percentage points.

arguments.name: NOPOLISH
arguments.description: Suppresses setting small interval probabilities to zero in the Turnbull algorithm.

arguments.name: PCTLIST=
arguments.description: Specifies the list of percentages for which to compute percentile estimates; value-list must be a list of values separated by blanks or commas. Each value in the list must be between 0 and 100.

arguments.name: PPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the plotting position type.

arguments.name: EXPRANK
arguments.description: Expected ranks

arguments.name: MEDRANK
arguments.description: Median ranks

arguments.name: MEDRANK1
arguments.description: Median ranks (exact formula)

arguments.name: KM
arguments.description: Kaplan-Meier

arguments.name: MKM
arguments.description: Modified Kaplan-Meier (default)

arguments.name: PPOUT
arguments.description: Specifies that a table of the cumulative probabilities plotted on the probability plot be displayed.

arguments.name: PREDICT
arguments.description: Requests predicted counts for exposure number for Poisson or sample size number for binomial.

arguments.name: PRINTPROBS
arguments.description: Prints intervals and associated probabilities for the Turnbull algorithm.

arguments.name: PSTABLE=
arguments.description: Specifies stable parameterization. The number must be between zero and one.

arguments.name: READOUT
arguments.description: Analyzes data in readout structure. The FREQ statement must be used to specify the number of units failing in each interval, and the NENTER statement must be used to specify the number of unfailed units entering each interval.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of scale parameter.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of shape parameter.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies singularity criterion for matrix inversion.

arguments.name: SURVTIME=
arguments.description: Requests that the survival function, cumulative distribution function, and confidence limits be computed for values in number-list

arguments.name: THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: Specifies a fixed threshold parameter.

arguments.name: TOLERANCE
arguments.description: Requests exposure for Poisson or sample size for binomial to estimate Poisson rate or binomial probability within number with probability given by the CONFIDENCE= option.

arguments.name: TOLLIKE=
arguments.description: Specifies criterion for convergence in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁸.

arguments.name: TOLPROB=
arguments.description: Specifies criterion for setting interval probability to zero in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁶.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: You can specify a BY statement with PROC RELIABILITY to obtain separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: The CLASS statement specifies variables in the input data set that serve as indicator, dummy, or classification variables in the MODEL statement.

arguments.name: BINOMIAL
arguments.description: Binomial distribution

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: [Exponential distribution

arguments.name: EXTREME
arguments.description: Extreme value distribution

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Generalized gamma distribution

arguments.name: LLOGISTIC
arguments.description: Loglogistic distribution

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic distribution

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL10
arguments.description: Lognormal (base 10) distribution

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Lognormal (base e) distribution

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Normal distribution

arguments.name: POISSON
arguments.description: Poisson distribution

arguments.name: WEIBULL
arguments.description: Weibull distribution

statements.name: FMODE
statements.description: Use the FMODE statement with data that have failures attributable to multiple causes, or failure modes.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies a LEGEND statement for individual mode fit lines.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses legend for individual mode fit lines.

arguments.name: PLOTMODES
arguments.description: Plots individual failure distribution lines on probability plot.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The FREQ statement specifies a variable that provides frequency counts for each observation in the input data set. If n is the value of the FREQ variable for an observation, then that observation is weighted by n.

statements.name: INSET
statements.description: The box or table of summary information produced on plots made with the PROBPLOT or MCFPLOT statement is called an inset. You can use the INSET statement to customize the information that is printed in the inset box and the appearance of the inset box.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Sample size

arguments.name: NUNITS1
arguments.description: Number of units or systems in the first group for MCF difference plots

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: CFILLH=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header background. By default, if you do not specify a CFILLH= color, the CFILL= color is used.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the frame. By default, the frame is the same color as the axis of the plot.

arguments.name: CHEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header text. By default, if you do not specify a CHEADER= color, the CTEXT= color is used.

arguments.name: CONFIDENCE
arguments.description: Confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals or for the Weibayes fit

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the text. By default, the inset text color is the same as the other text on the plot.

arguments.name: FIT
arguments.description: Method used to estimate distribution parameters for probability plots

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font of the text. By default, the font is SIMPLEX if the inset is located in the interior of the plot, and the font is the same as the other text displayed on the plot if the inset is located in the exterior of the plot.

arguments.name: HEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the header or box title text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the text in screen percent units.

arguments.name: NEVENTS
arguments.description: Number of events or repairs for MCF plots

arguments.name: NEVENTS1
arguments.description: Number of events or repairs in the first group for MCF difference plots

arguments.name: NFAIL
arguments.description: Number of failures for probability plots

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame drawn around the text.

arguments.name: NUNITS
arguments.description: Number of units or systems for MCF plots

arguments.name: NUNITS2
arguments.description: Number of units or systems in the second group for MCF difference plots

arguments.name: POS=
arguments.description: Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, a margin keyword, or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in axis percent units or axis data units.

arguments.name: REFPOINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates with the POSITION= option.

arguments.name: BR
arguments.description: Bottom right

arguments.name: BL
arguments.description: Bottom left

arguments.name: TR
arguments.description: Top right

arguments.name: TL
arguments.description: Top left

arguments.name: RSQUARE
arguments.description: R² for least squares distribution fit to probability plots

statements.name: LOGSCALE
statements.description: You use the LOGSCALE statement to model the logarithm of the distribution scale parameter as a function of explanatory variables.

arguments.name: INITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies initial values for log-scale regression parameters other than the intercept term.

arguments.name: INTERCEPT=
arguments.description: Specifies initial or fixed value of the intercept parameter, depending on whether INTINIT is present.

statements.name: MAKE
statements.description: The MAKE statement creates a SAS data set from any of the tables produced by the RELIABILITY procedure.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the output data set.

statements.name: MCFPLOT
statements.description: Creates a plot of the mean cumulative function. You can specify any number of MCFPLOT statements after a PROC RELIABILITY statement. Each MCFPLOT statement creates a separate MCF plot and associated analysis.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications in an AXIS statement. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CCENSOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for filling the censor plot area. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CENBIN
arguments.description: Plots censored data as frequency counts (rounding for noninteger frequency) rather than as individual points.

arguments.name: CENCOLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the censor symbol. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CENSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies symbols for censored values. The symbol is one of the symbol names (plus, star, square, diamond, triangle, hash, paw, point, dot, and circle) or a letter (A–Z).

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. This area is not shaded by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Color for filling frame for row labels.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Color for filling frame for column labels.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for grid lines. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CONFIDENCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.95.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Description for graphics catalog member.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, and value1 must be less than value2.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

arguments.name: HLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the offset for the horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: Specifies reference lines perpendicular to horizontal axis

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of labels for HREF= lines.
Top
Staggered from top
Bottom
Staggered from bottom
Alternating from top
Alternating from bottom

arguments.name: HUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies value as the upper lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined automatically.

arguments.name: INBORDER
arguments.description: Requests a border around probability plots.

arguments.name: INDINC
arguments.description: Requests variance estimates of the MCF using the Nelson estimator under an independent increments assumption.

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for text inside framed areas.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies height of text inside framed areas.

arguments.name: INTERPOLATE=
arguments.description: Requests that symbols in an MCF plot be connected with a straight line or step function.

arguments.name: JOIN
arguments.description: Requests that symbols in an MCF plot be connected with a straight line function.

arguments.name: STEP
arguments.description: Requests that symbols in an MCF plot be connected with a step function.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance between tiles.

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies a line style for all grid lines; linetype is between 1 and 46. The default is 35.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOGINTERVALS
arguments.description: Requests that confidence intervals be computed based on the asymptotic normality of log(MCF).

arguments.name: LOGLOG
arguments.description: Requests log scales on both axes.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MCFLEGEND=
arguments.description: Identifies legend statement to specify legend for overlaid MCF plots.

arguments.name: MINORLOGGRID
arguments.description: Adds a minor grid for log axes.

arguments.name: MISSING1
arguments.description: Requests that missing values of first GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.

arguments.name: MISSING2
arguments.description: Requests that missing values of second GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters, in graphics catalog.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies number of columns plotted on a page.

arguments.name: NHTICK=
arguments.description: Suppresses tick marks and tick mark labels for horizontal axis.

arguments.name: NOCENPLOT
arguments.description: Suppresses the plotting of censored data points.

arguments.name: NOCONF
arguments.description: Suppresses the default percentile confidence bands on the probability plot.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around plotting areas.

arguments.name: NOGRID
arguments.description: Suppresses grid lines.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses label for horizontal axis.

arguments.name: NOHTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses tick marks and tick mark labels for horizontal axis.

arguments.name: NOVARIANCE
arguments.description: Suppresses MCF variance computation.

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses label for vertical axis.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses tick marks and tick mark labels for vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies number of rows plotted on a page.

arguments.name: ONINSET
arguments.description: Suppresses inset.

arguments.name: ORDER1=
arguments.description: Specifies display order for values of the first GROUP= variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: ORDER2=
arguments.description: Specifies display order for values of the second GROUP= variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Requests overlaid plots for group variables.

arguments.name: PLOTCOLOR=
arguments.description: Colors of symbols representing events in an MCF plot.

arguments.name: PLOTSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Symbols representing events in an MCF plot.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Vertically strings out characters in labels for vertical axis.

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Alternate method of specifying variance calculation. Includes INDINC and VARMETHOD2 options.

arguments.name: INDINC
arguments.description: Nelson's method assuming independent increments

arguments.name: LAWLESS
arguments.description: Lawless-Nadeau method

arguments.name: POISSON
arguments.description: Poisson process method

arguments.name: VARMETHOD2
arguments.description: Requests that the method of Lawless and Nadeau (1995) be used to compute variance estimates of the MCF.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the vertical axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, and value1 must be less than value2.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the vertical axis scale.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: Length of offset at upper end of vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Requests reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of labels for VREF= lines.
Left
Right

arguments.name: VUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper limit on the vertical axis scale.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies line thickness for axes and frame. The default value is 1.

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: You use the MODEL statement to fit regression models, where life is modeled as a function of explanatory variables

arguments.name: CONFIDENCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.95.

arguments.name: CONVERGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: CONVH=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.

arguments.name: COORB
arguments.description: Requests parameter correlation matrix.

arguments.name: COVB
arguments.description: Requests parameter covariance matrix.

arguments.name: ITPRINT
arguments.description: Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

arguments.name: LRCL
arguments.description: Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.

arguments.name: MAXIT=
arguments.description: Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: OBSTATS=
arguments.description: OBSTATS requests a table containing the XBETA, SURV, SRESID, and ADJRESID statistics. The table also contains the dependent and independent variables in the model. OBSTATS(statistics) requests a table containing the model variables and the statistics specified below: CENSOR is an indicator variable equal to 1 if an observation is censored, and 0 otherwise QUANTILES | QUANTILE | Q=number-list specifies distribution quantiles for each number in number list for each observation. The numbers must be between 0 and 1. Estimated quantile standard errors, and upper and lower confidence limits are also tabulated. XBETA is the linear predictor SURVIVAL | SURV is the fitted survival function, evaluated at the value of the dependent variable RESID is the raw residual SRESID is the standardized residual GRESID is the modified Cox-Snell residual DRESID is the deviance residual ADJRESID is the adjusted standardized residuals. These are adjusted for right-censored observations by adding the median of the lifetime greater than the right-censored values to the residuals. RESIDADJ=number specifies adjustment to be added to Cox-Snell residual for right-censored data values. The default is log(2) = 0.693. RESIDALPHA | RALPHA=number specifies number x 100% percentile residual lifetime used to adjust right-censored standardized residuals. The number must be between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.5, corresponding to the median.
arguments.help: OBSTATS=             CONTROL= | RESIDALPHA= | RALPHA= | RESIDADJ= | ADJRESID | RESID | SRESID |              GRESID | DRESID | SURVIVAL | SURV | XBETA | QUANTILES= | QUANTILE= | Q= | CENSOR

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies sort order for values of the classification variables in the effect-list.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: PSTABLE=
arguments.description: Specifies stable parameterization. The number must be between zero and one.

arguments.name: READOUT
arguments.description: Analyzes data in readout structure. The FREQ statement must be used to specify the number of units failing in each interval, and the NENTER statement must be used to specify the number of unfailed units entering each interval.

arguments.name: RELATION=
arguments.description: Specifies type of relationship between independent and dependent variables.

arguments.name: ARRHENIUS
arguments.description: ARRHENIUS (Nelson parameterization)

arguments.name: ARRHENIUS2
arguments.description: ARRHENIUS2 (activation energy parameterization)

arguments.name: POWER
arguments.description: POWER relationship

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: LINEAR relationship

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: LOGISTIC relationship

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of scale parameter.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of shape parameter.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies singularity criterion for matrix inversion.

arguments.name: THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: Specifies a fixed threshold parameter.

statements.name: NENTER
statements.description: Use the NENTER statement in conjunction with the FREQ statement to specify interval-censored data having a special structure; these data are called readout data. The NENTER statement specifies a variable in the input data set that determines the number of unfailed units entering each interval.

statements.name: PROBPLOT
statements.description: You use the PROBPLOT statement to create a probability plot from complete, left-censored, right-censored, or interval-censored data.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications in an AXIS statement. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CCENSOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for filling the censor plot area. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CENBIN
arguments.description: Plots censored data as frequency counts (rounding for noninteger frequency) rather than as individual points.

arguments.name: CENCOLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the censor symbol. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CENSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies symbols for censored values. The symbol is one of the symbol names (plus, star, square, diamond, triangle, hash, paw, point, dot, and circle) or a letter (A–Z).

arguments.name: CFIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the fitted probability line and confidence curves. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. This area is not shaded by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Color for filling frame for row labels.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Color for filling frame for column labels.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for grid lines. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: CONFIDENCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.95.

arguments.name: CONVERGE=
arguments.description: Sets the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: CONVH=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.

arguments.name: COORB
arguments.description: Requests parameter correlation matrix.

arguments.name: COVB
arguments.description: Requests parameter covariance matrix.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the device color list.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Description for graphics catalog member.

arguments.name: FITTYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies method of estimating distribution parameters.
arguments.help: FITTYPE=LSYX | LSXY | MLE | MODEL | NONE | WEIBAYES

arguments.name: LSYX
arguments.description: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The probability axis is the dependent variable.

arguments.name: LSXY
arguments.description: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The lifetime axis is the dependent variable.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Maximum likelihood (default)

arguments.name: MODEL
arguments.description: Uses the fit from the preceding MODEL statement.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No fit is computed.

arguments.name: WEIBAYES
arguments.description: Syntax: WEIBAYES<(CONFIDENCE=number)> Weibayes method, where number is the confidence coefficient for the Weibayes fit and is between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.95.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement.

arguments.name: HCL
arguments.description: Computes and draws confidence limits for the predicted probabilities in the horizontal direction.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

arguments.name: HLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the offset for the horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: Requests reference lines perpendicular to horizontal axis. If (INTERSECT) is specified, a second reference line perpendicular to the vertical axis is drawn that intersects the fit line at the same point as the horizontal axis reference line. If a horizontal axis reference line label is specified, the intersecting vertical axis reference line is labeled with the vertical axis value.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of labels for HREF= lines.
Top
Staggered from top
Bottom
Staggered from bottom
Alternating from top
Alternating from bottom

arguments.name: HUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies value as the upper lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined automatically.

arguments.name: INBORDER
arguments.description: Requests a border around probability plots.

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for text inside framed areas.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies height of text inside framed areas.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance between tiles.

arguments.name: ITPRINT
arguments.description: Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: ITPRINTEM
arguments.description: Requests iteration history for the Turnbull algorithm.

arguments.name: LAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies tick mark values for the lifetime axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, and value1 must be less than value2.

arguments.name: LFIT=
arguments.description: Specifies a line style for fitted curves and confidence limits. By default, fitted curves are drawn by connecting solid lines (linetype = 1), and confidence limits are drawn by connecting dashed lines (linetype = 3).

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies a line style for all grid lines; linetype is between 1 and 46. The default is 35.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LIFELOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The LLOWER option specifies number as the lower lifetime axis tick mark.

arguments.name: LIFEUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper limit on the lifetime axis scale. The LUPPER option specifies number as the upper lifetime axis tick mark.

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

arguments.name: LRCL
arguments.description: Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.

arguments.name: LRCLPER
arguments.description: Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution percentiles.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is 2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXIT=
arguments.description: Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

arguments.name: MAXITEM=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed for the Turnbull algorithm. Iteration history will be displayed in increments of n2 if requested with the ITPRINTEM option.

arguments.name: MISSING1
arguments.description: Requests that missing values of first GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.

arguments.name: MISSING2
arguments.description: Requests that missing values of second GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters, in graphics catalog.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies number of columns plotted on a page.

arguments.name: NOCENPLOT
arguments.description: Suppresses the plotting of censored data points.

arguments.name: NOCONF
arguments.description: Suppresses the default percentile confidence bands on the probability plot.

arguments.name: NOFIT
arguments.description: Suppresses the fitted probability (percentile) line and confidence bands.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around plotting areas.

arguments.name: NOGRID
arguments.description: Suppresses grid lines.

arguments.name: NOPCTILES
arguments.description: Suppresses computation of percentiles for standard list of percentage points.

arguments.name: NOPOLISH
arguments.description: Suppresses setting small interval probabilities to zero in the Turnbull algorithm.

arguments.name: NOPPLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses legend for overlaid probability plots.

arguments.name: NOPPOS
arguments.description: Suppresses plotting of symbols for failures in a probability plot.

arguments.name: NPINTERVALS=
arguments.description: Specifies type of nonparametric confidence interval displayed in a probability plot.

arguments.name: POINTWISE
arguments.description: Pointwise confidence intervals for the CDF

arguments.name: SIMUL
arguments.description: Simultaneous confidence intervals for the CDF

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies number of rows plotted on a page.

arguments.name: ONINSET
arguments.description: Suppresses inset.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies sort order for values of the classification variables in the effect-list.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Requests overlaid plots for group variables.

arguments.name: PCONFPLT
arguments.description: Plots confidence intervals on probabilities for readout data.

arguments.name: PCTLIST=
arguments.description: Specifies the list of percentages for which to compute percentile estimates; value-list must be a list of values separated by blanks or commas. Each value in the list must be between 0 and 100.

arguments.name: PCTLOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower limit on the probability axis scale. The PLOWER= option specifies value as the lower probability axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically.

arguments.name: PCTUPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper limit on the probability axis scale. The PUPPER= option specifies value as the upper probability axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined automatically.

arguments.name: PINTERVALS=
arguments.description: Type of parametric pointwise confidence interval displayed in a probability plot.

arguments.name: LIKELIHOOD
arguments.description: Likelihood ratio confidence intervals

arguments.name: PERCENTILES
arguments.description: Pointwise parametric confidence intervals for the percentiles of the fitted CDF

arguments.name: PROBABILITY
arguments.description: Pointwise parametric confidence intervals for the cumulative failure probabilities

arguments.name: PPLEGEND=
arguments.description: Identifies LEGENDn statement to specify legend for overlaid probability plots.

arguments.name: PPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the plotting position type.

arguments.name: EXPRANK
arguments.description: Expected ranks

arguments.name: MEDRANK
arguments.description: Median ranks

arguments.name: MEDRANK1
arguments.description: Median ranks (exact formula)

arguments.name: KM
arguments.description: Kaplan-Meier

arguments.name: MKM
arguments.description: Modified Kaplan-Meier (default)

arguments.name: PPOSCOLOR=
arguments.description: Colors of symbols representing failures on a probability plot.

arguments.name: PPOSSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Symbols representing failures on a probability plot.

arguments.name: PPOUT
arguments.description: Specifies that a table of the cumulative probabilities plotted on the probability plot be displayed.

arguments.name: PRINTPROBS
arguments.description: Prints intervals and associated probabilities for the Turnbull algorithm.

arguments.name: PROBLIST=
arguments.description: Specifies the list of initial values for the Turnbull algorithm

arguments.name: PSTABLE=
arguments.description: Specifies stable parameterization. The number must be between zero and one.

arguments.name: READOUT
arguments.description: Analyzes data in readout structure. The FREQ statement must be used to specify the number of units failing in each interval, and the NENTER statement must be used to specify the number of unfailed units entering each interval.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: Requests probability plots with probability scale on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of scale parameter.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Specifies fixed or initial value of shape parameter.

arguments.name: SHOWMULTIPLES
arguments.description: Display the count for multiple overlaying symbols.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies singularity criterion for matrix inversion.

arguments.name: SURVTIME=
arguments.description: Requests that the survival function, cumulative distribution function, and confidence limits be computed for values in number-list

arguments.name: THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: Specifies a fixed threshold parameter.

arguments.name: TOLLIKE=
arguments.description: Specifies criterion for convergence in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁸.

arguments.name: TOLPROB=
arguments.description: Specifies criterion for setting interval probability to zero in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁶.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Vertically strings out characters in labels for vertical axis.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: Length of offset at upper end of vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Requests reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of labels for VREF= lines.
Left
Right

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies line thickness for axes and frame. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: WFIT=
arguments.description: Line width for fit line and confidence curves.

arguments.name: WGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies line thickness for grids. The default value is 1.

statements.name: RELATIONPLOT
statements.description: You use the RELATIONPLOT statement to create life-stress relation plots. A life-stress relation plot is a graphical tool for the analysis of data from accelerated life tests. The plot is a display of the relationship between life and stress, such as temperature or voltage.

statements.name: UNITID
statements.description: The UNITID statement names a variable in the input data set that is used to identify each individual uni t in an MCFPLOT statement. The value of the UNITID variable for an observation corresponds to the name of the unit in the study for which a repair or end of history has occurred.
